Hi C=EDcero 

There's nothing wrong with that approach - infact seems a ver=
y good
idea.  One thing to be aware of though, is there is only one instanc=
e
of the fitness function created, so you have to test bots one at a
time a=
nd then update the function with a new Chromosome (and hence a
new bot).  I=
 seem to remember you wanted to have a multi threaded
version of this.  NEA=
T4J does support distributed learning, and each
learning agent will have th=
eir own instance of the appropriate fitness
function.

Let me know how it g=
oes, and if the process works I can integrate it
into the NEAT4J framework.=


Cheers

Matt


--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "C=EDcero Augusto" <ciceroaug=
usto@...> wrote:
>
> Hi, I'm trying to do something like that but with unre=
al tournament
bots.
> 
> Instead of overriding the initialise method I exte=
nded the
> NEATFitnessFunction where the method evolve generates the NN and=

associates
> it to the bot, than I connect the bot to the game and after s=
ome time I
> disconnect him and call a method from the bot that returns me =
his
score or
> something like that.
> 
> Is there something wrong with my w=
ay of doing this kind of experiment?
> 
> On 11/4/06, Matt Simmerson <m.sim=
merson@...> wrote:
> >
> >   Hey guys
> >
> > It is possible, I am just por=
ting this bit of functionality from my
> > original AI framework.
> >
> > B=
asically, you have to create a class that extends
> > NEATGATrainingManager=
 and overrides initialise(). In the new
> > initialise() method, call super=
.initialise(0 and then create the robot
> > NNs from the GA population. You=
 can then put these in an arena where
> > you feed the nets realt time inpu=
ts eg speed, direction etc. As your
> > bot goes around it will be given a =
raw score based on your criteria.
> > Assign this score to the nets Chromos=
ome. Your fitness function then
> > becomes very simple.
> >
> > public dou=
ble evaluate(Chromosome genoType) {
> > return (genoType.fitness());
> > }
=
> >
> > Is all it needs to be. The evolution process then takes place as
> =
> normal and a new generation is born.
> >
> > If you want me to look over =
any code, feel free to email it to me.
> >
> > I will place a tutorial up s=
oon (work is busy - family is young - time
> > is therefore short) that sho=
ws how to evolve a chess player.
> > Different domain, but similar principa=
ls in that there is no input
data.
> >
> > Any queries, please ask. I want =
this software to be as useful as
> > possible.
> >
> > Cheers
> >
> > Matt
=
> >

speed and so on. Outputs
of the

ed NEATGATrainingManager) the
Neural Net

ovided by the xor/xor.csv file.

ave any training data
available,

ks and evaluate them by applying

ow fast walks the robot,

at it does not need a
